channel.title: Local SMTP server for SMF smtp_mail() fuction
channel.description: Ok I am hosting my website from home, and I have having trouble with spammers on my forum. He is using a fake email every time, and his IP keeps changing. I realized that forcing activation via email is the best way to go here. So I changed SMF source to work locally rather than on an external web server that already has a SMTP server set up, and then installed a SMTP server on my computer. My question is, does anyone know of a better way to send email automatically, locally, rather then host a server?

item.title: Local SMTP server for SMF smtp_mail() fuction
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“spy man47, post:4, topic:338325”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=434714.msg3192848#msg3192848 date=1272429922]

You don’t have to change anything in the SMF source to make it use different SMTP servers or even a local mail server, so I’m not sure what you meant by that.

I just have postfix running on this server to use from php’s mail function, I don’t have it configured to accept mail or route it or anything, as it’s not needed, SMF just sends it with a reply-to email of the forum administrator. It was as simple as an ‘apt-get install postfix’ and didn’t require any extra configuration, it just works.
[/quote]By changing the source, I just meant changing the config file with the SMTP settings in it. (php.ini I believe) It was more of a web server change then a SMF change, sorry if that was confusing.

I use Windows XP.

Can’t you change to Windows 7?[/quote]Windows XP is fine, I have 7 on my other 2 computers.
